title: Nobody Knows I’m a Bad Chess Player
sub_head: Online games are always available at any skill level—even none whatsoever.
body:
‘The Queen’s Gambit,” the streaming television drama about fictional chess prodigy Beth Harmon’s quixotic quest for glory, was Netflix’s most popular show until surpassed by “The Crown.” You might say it was captured by the queen.
The entertaining miniseries based on the Walter Tevis novel raised chess’s profile. It also likely terrified would-be players who were intimidated by what they saw. Ms. Harmon plays entire matches in her mind, visualizing every move and countermove. She also can play multiple chess games simultaneously,...
